channel.title: Launch Details Discussion
channel.description:
We want to make sure all of you are ready for the big day. If you don't already know, Black Mesa will require the FREE Source SDK Base 2007 to run. If you are not too sure that you have Source SDK Base 2007 installed or you don't own any source based games, please [url='steam://run/218']click here[/url] to download and install the Source SDK Base via Steam for FREE.
I know many of you loyal Half Life fans are planning on taking a vacation day from work, calling out sick for school, or even both. We are working very hard to ensure your day off does not go in vain, and that every person trying to download Black Mesa will undergo a smooth and fast downloading experience. The approximate download size will be [b]3.03 GB[/b], [b]8 GB[/b] uncompressed. At launch, a launch pad will be available offering multiple mirrors and options for download. These options shall be revealed during launch. So go ahead, take that day off and [url='https://www.facebook.com/events/179981922137074/']join us[/url]!
We know you all are very excited and we want to you share your gameplay experiences as soon as you finish playing. We also want to make sure to collect any bug reporting and get any resolved as quickly as possible. With that being said, the forums shall be moved to it's own separate server. So when you are finished re-visiting Black Mesa, we'll be here to hear all about it.
We are very excited and we are counting down the days right along with you!
- Hubi

item.title: Launch Details Discussion
item.dc:creator: Tuskin38
item.description:
Shadowhand:

I’m sorry if this is asked already, but 14 pages are a lot to read.
My concern is, now that BMS is greenlit on steam, if I want to download on steam, will I download whole 8gb or the setup (which’s 3.03gigs)?

I don’t think anyways knows yet. It would probably download like HL2, check how much space it takes up and then how much it downloads.

Read full topic

item.title: Launch Details Discussion
item.dc:creator: umbrion
item.description:
My parents bought me HL for the PC when it first came out… I remember it being the game to test my system on when I was buidling crappy PCs out of used parts… im talking Pentium 2 processors and 16mb video card. I have played and replayed all the games… over and over… when I heard about Black Mesa… i freaked out. Told random strangers about it… all my friends know.

It is the single most anticipated recreation of any game I have ever looked forward too… HL is the game that got me into PC gaming… I have a HL tattoo on the back of my wrist…

Just one day left… one day

Read full topic

item.title: Launch Details Discussion
item.dc:creator: UrBY
item.description:
When the countdown stops, I will have one hour left at work. It’s going to be one of the longest hours of my life.

Then I have to drive 40 minutes to get home. That’s going to be the last 40 minutes of the lives of anyone foolish enough to get in my way.

Read full topic

item.title: Launch Details Discussion
item.dc:creator: Fullmetal99012
item.description:
Yup:

I have half life 2 installed on steam. im set for the mod right?

before you get flamed on. go to your steam library. click “All games” near the top, click tool on the drop down list. find “Source SDK base 2007.” Install that, and then your ready to play.

item.title: Launch Details Discussion
item.dc:creator: Phobos001
item.description:
This is going to be amazing.

I also like how you guys set up the counter to change for all the different sites so it is at an appropriate size for each. But this confuses me:

//Give the date --------------------------------- year = 2012; month = 9; day = 14; //Give the point of time ------------------------ [B]hour= 14[/B]; min= 47; sec= 0;

Hour 14 (2:47 PM)? Why doesn’t it say 8 (8:47 AM)? Am I missing something?

(Yes I was bored.)[/SIZE]

Read full topic

item.title: Launch Details Discussion
item.dc:creator: the_prospektor
item.description:
SarahDank:

That’s crazy to think that you have only played the original once, and personally ive played it like… at least 15. /addict.

I’ve only played it once as well! Which is weird, since I am a huge Half-Life fan. It’s probably because HL1 is a huge time commitment and I don’t like to leave play-throughs unfinished. Now, as for Blue Shift and Opposing Force, I have played those multiple times since they’re a lot shorter.

Read full topic

item.title: Launch Details Discussion
item.dc:creator: SarahDank
item.description:
Mark:

I’ve never played it before. When I found out about this mod two years ago I decided to wait.

I’ve played a bit of Blue Shift and all of HL2 and the episodes.

what?!!! no way :fffuuu:

item.title: Launch Details Discussion
item.dc:creator: Atomic_Waffle
item.description:
Just ran through the entire series myself, as well. I remember getting all of the games as part of Half-Life: Platinum Edition. My brother borrowed a copy of HL1 from his friend and that was my first experience… After that, I practically begged my father to get me a copy.

It’s a pretty weird feeling, but this feels like another HL game is being released. I’m about on par with excitement to this as I remember being to the HL Episodes.

Read full topic
